Try it

cURL

Python

JavaScript

PHP

Go

Java

Copy

```
curl --request POST \
  --url https://app.chatwoot.com/api/v1/accounts/{account_id}/agents \
  --header 'Content-Type: application/json' \
  --header 'api_access_token: <api-key>' \
  --data '{
  "name": "John Doe",
  "email": "john.doe@acme.inc",
  "role": "agent",
  "availability_status": "available",
  "auto_offline": true
}'
```

#### Authorizations

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/agents/add-a-new-agent#authorization-api-access-token)

api\_access\_token

string

header

required

This token can be obtained by visiting the profile page or via rails console. Provides access to endpoints based on the user permissions levels. This token can be saved by an external system when user is created via API, to perform activities on behalf of the user.

#### Path Parameters

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/agents/add-a-new-agent#parameter-account-id)

account\_id

integer

required

The numeric ID of the account

#### Body

application/json

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/agents/add-a-new-agent#body-name)

name

string

required

Full Name of the agent

Example:

`"John Doe"`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/agents/add-a-new-agent#body-email)

email

string

required

Email of the Agent

Example:

`"john.doe@acme.inc"`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/agents/add-a-new-agent#body-role)

role

enum<string>

required

Whether its administrator or agent

Available options:

`agent`,

`administrator`

Example:

`"agent"`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/agents/add-a-new-agent#body-availability-status)

availability\_status

enum<string>

The availability setting of the agent.

Available options:

`available`,

`busy`,

`offline`

Example:

`"available"`

[​](https://developers.chatwoot.com/api-reference/agents/add-a-new-agent#body-auto-offline)

auto\_offline

boolean

Whether the availability status of agent is configured to go offline automatically when away.

Example:

`true`
